definition[0]: the planet we live on, and all the people, cities, and countries on it
example[0]: Tuberculosis is still common in some parts of the world.
example[1]: At that time China was the most powerful country in the world.
example[3]: The Taj Mahal attracts visitors from around the world.
example[4]: Students from all over the world come to study at Oxford.
example[5]: Children are the same the world over.
example[6]: The book has been published throughout the world.
example[7]: There is nothing quite like it anywhere in the world.
example[8]: Europe’s relationship with the rest of the world
example[9]: I decided to take a year off to travel the world.
example[10]: a crime that shocked the world
example[11]: the fastest sports car in the world
bad_example[0]: the fastest sports car in world
bad_example[1]: the fastest sport car on the world
definition[1]: normal life in society, as opposed to a religious way of life, especially in a monastery etc
example[12]: She renounced the world and entered a convent.
